XinFin’s XDC is a hybrid blockchain technology in development to deliver real world and enterprise grade integrations into the financial ecosystem. The Singapore based fintech is working on providing blockchain connectivity, transactions and financing mechanism to the real world applications through the Internet of Things (IoT) enabled devices or projects. XinFin has rolled out TradeFinex (https://www.tradefinex.org/) platform that enables enterprises around the globe to trade and finance projects that banking institutions are unable to take up. XinFin focus is to bridge the huge inefficiencies in global supply chain and bridge the $5 trillion infrastructure deficit.Anyone holding XDC tokens can become a financier on the TradeFinex platform. Investments are subject to risks; XinFin recommends carrying out due diligence before investing. An investor can finance a project along with several other financiers. Their underlying smart contracts will support this. Smart contracts will provide transparency and visibility on repayment to participating financiers. Beneficiaries can post projects on TradeFinex platform and reach out to global financiers for funding and global suppliers for procurement. However, XinFin is currently working on providing a peer to peer financing platform through its XDC network directly into the IoT Enabled water Purifier ATM machine in remote villages in the parts of Africa and India that supplies clean drinkable water at a highly subsidised rate. The same architecture can be easily scaled up in the long term by the Governments or institutions to secure/raise finance from global investors for critical infrastructure projects that are neglected and glamour-less for investors. The applications of XinFin’s XDC platform are endless and can be applicable to institutional/retail as well as Government Financing. From the compliance aspect, XinFin’s XDC network will work with regulated or existing market makers or money changers in the long term. The platform can be integrated with existing legacy systems using XinFin APIs, thereby, making it simple, economical and convenient to use. XinFin hybrid Blockchain also offers a secure digital ledger for storing data performing settlement using XDC protocol. Applications for XinFin’s Blockchain technology are immense and XinFin is currently working on several in-house projects in the area of Solar power, Travel, Payments, Aerospace, Medical ambulance services, Water solutions, etc. to name a few. Recently Singapore’s fintech was also invited to speak by Central Bank of India’s research arm at their event. XinFin’s team is one of the speaker at Blockchain Technology summit, India chapter. Such companies as IBM, Microsoft, Walmart, JPMorgan Chase, Nasdaq, Foxconn and Visa are pursuing blockchain technology; so too is Maersk, the shipping giant. Venture capitalists have also invested some $1.5 billion into it. There is some question about whether such businesses have a full understanding of how blockchain technology might be of benefit to them, but there is great optimism about its future — and ample reason for other companies to get on board. William Mougayar, a venture capitalist at Virtual Capital Ventures, advisor to such blockchain organizations such as the Ethereum Foundation and author of the book “Opening Digital Markets,” told Forbes that blockchain is at present where the Internet was in 1993-94 — poised to explode. In his mind, blockchain can be viewed through technical, business and legal prisms, in that the technology provides not only a ledger but an exchange network — an alternative to traditional currency and banking, as it has been called elsewhere. Read more of my thoughts on this topic on my blog!

Many use-cases being adopted by businesses right now of blockchain technology are contained within private blockchains through companies like Hyperledger, R3, or Ripple. This is because businesses are happy with private databases and don’t want to overhaul their systems to interact with public networks. The private blockchain model generally fails to achieve the 3 key benefits of blockchain technology: transparency, immutability, and decentralization. These benefits, which have far-reaching implications for security, will likely only be realized on blockchain architectures that are open, public, and distributed. Our company, Hydrogen, is using APIs to bring the benefits of the Ethereum public blockchain to private businesses. Our APIs interact with smart contracts, so businesses can achieve blockchain functionality with just a few API calls. I think this will be the approach that brings blockchain to businesses in the near future.
